items.title: Cummins ruled out of T20 World Cup as Smith snubbed despite stellar form
items.description: Pat Cummins will miss the T20 World Cup after failing to recover from his back injury, while Steve Smith, fresh from a blistering BBL cameo, isn't named in Australia's final 15-man squad.

items.title: Scientists drill through Antarctica's 'Doomsday Glacier'
items.description:
Researchers drilling through nearly 3,000 feet of ice have broken through to the ocean beneath Antarctica's Thwaites Glacier, marking a milestone in a high-stakes mission to understand one of the planet's most unstable ice masses.

A joint British and South Korean team punched through the ice on Thursday afternoon local time, according to PBS science correspondent Miles O'Brien, who is embedded with the expedition. After more than 21 hours of continuous drilling, instruments designed to measure temperature, salinity, and ocean currents were lowered into waters that scientists believe are eroding the glacier from below.[1][2]

items.title: Live: Sabalenka's mission to reclaim Aus Open crown culminates in final against Rybakina
items.description: Aryna Sabalenka tries to win her third Australian Open singles title and fifth grand slam crown as she meets 2022 Wimbledon champion Elena Rybakina in the women's singles final. Follow live.

items.title: Man accused of posing as talent agent to lure young actors into sex acts
items.description: The 57-year-old told a Sydney court he posed as a Disney executive because he was "lonely" but only ever shouted people coffee or dinners.

items.title: Kevin Rudd responds after his name is referred to in Epstein document dump
items.description: The newly released Epstein documents show the New York sex offender sought a wide-ranging network of political and financial contacts, including former Australian prime minister Kevin Rudd.

items.title: Police continue to probe Perth family's 'heartbreaking' murder-suicide
items.description: WA Premier Roger Cook says the deaths of a family of four at their Perth home in an apparent murder-suicide is both "heartbreaking" and "unimaginable".

items.title: Trump announces Washington IndyCar race which could pass White House
items.description: The capital of the United States will get an IndyCar street race as part of the nation's 250th anniversary of independence celebrations, and President Donald Trump is pushing hard for the race route to pass the White House.

items.title: Tyra Banks's 'hot ice cream' went viral. Don't expect to see it called that anymore
items.description: Reviews have said it "tasted like soggy biscuits" and was "a weird sensation to sip through a straw". Taste aside, something bugged me. How can you call something ice cream if it's not iced?

items.title: Venezuela frees all known US detainees, announces amnesty law

featured_image.name: Venezuela announces amnesty bill that could lead to mass release ...

items.description:
Venezuela's interim president, Delcy Rodríguez, announced Friday a general amnesty law covering political prisoners detained since 1999, a measure that could benefit hundreds of detainees as the South American nation moves to satisfy U.S. demands nearly a month after Nicolás Maduro's capture by American forces.

The announcement, made during an event at the Supreme Court of Justice in Caracas, comes as the U.S. Embassy confirmed it had secured the release of all known American citizens detained in Venezuela.[1][2]

items.title: Carlyle in talks with UAE investors over Lukoil asset deal

featured_image.name: Exclusive: Carlyle in talks with potential UAE partners on Lukoil assets, sources say

items.description:
Carlyle Group has begun exploratory talks with Abu Dhabi investors about bringing in partners should its preliminary agreement to acquire Russian oil producer Lukoil's international assets proceed, according to Reuters, which cited three sources with knowledge of the process.[1][2]

The discussions come just one day after Carlyle and Lukoil announced the provisional deal on Thursday, which would transfer a sweeping portfolio of oilfields in Iraq and refineries in Eastern Europe to the U.S. private equity firm, pending approval from U.S. sanctions authorities.[3][4]

items.title: Top AI models score below 40% on new expert-level benchmark
items.description:
A new benchmark designed to push the limits of artificial intelligence has been formally published in the journal Nature, revealing that even the most advanced AI systems score below 40% on questions that probe the frontier of human knowledge.

"Humanity's Last Exam" comprises 2,500 expert-level questions spanning more than 100 academic subfields, from interpreting ancient Palmyrene script on Roman tombstones to analyzing hummingbird skeletal structures. The benchmark represents a global collaboration of nearly 1,000 professors and researchers from over 500 institutions across 50 countries, including contributors from KAIST and Yonsei University in South Korea.[1][2]

items.title: Mexico warns of humanitarian crisis after Trump tariffs on Cuba oil

featured_image.name: Mexico to seek diplomatic solution after US threatens Cuba oil tariffs

items.description:
Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum warned Friday that US tariffs targeting countries that supply oil to Cuba could trigger a "far-reaching humanitarian crisis," as she announced her government would pursue diplomatic channels while seeking alternatives to assist the Caribbean island.

The announcement came one day after President Donald Trump signed an executive order authorizing tariffs on goods from any nation that directly or indirectly provides oil to Cuba, declaring the island "an unusual and extraordinary threat" to US national security. The decree did not specify tariff rates or which countries would be affected.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: Bomb cyclone targets Southeast as Australia's record heat persists

featured_image.name: Severe weather brings heavy snow and ice across the U.S.

items.description:
As the United States reels from its deadliest winter storm in years, with at least 117 deaths confirmed and another bomb cyclone bearing down on the East Coast, Australia is simultaneously enduring its most severe heatwave since the 2019-20 Black Summer. Scientists say both events bear the unmistakable fingerprint of a warming planet.

Winter Storm Fern, which swept across the nation from January 23-26, brought catastrophic ice and snow from Northern Mexico to New England, causing over a million power outages and preliminary damage estimates exceeding $1 billion. Meanwhile, southeastern Australia has recorded temperatures approaching 50 degrees Celsius (122 degrees Fahrenheit), setting all-time records across multiple states.[1][2][3]

items.title: Bob Iger plans early exit as Disney board nears new CEO decision

featured_image.name: Disney CEO Bob Iger confirms he will step down at end of ...

items.description:
Bob Iger has informed associates he intends to step down as chief executive of the Walt Disney Company before his contract expires at the end of 2026, according to The Wall Street Journal. The entertainment giant's board of directors is scheduled to convene next week at Disney's headquarters in Burbank, California, where they are expected to select Iger's successor.[1][2][3]

The announcement signals a turning point in a succession process that has shadowed one of Hollywood's most influential executives. For Disney, the stakes are especially high after the company's 2020 leadership transition ended with the dismissal of Bob Chapek and the forced return of the 74-year-old Iger.[4][5]

items.title: SpaceX earned $8 billion profit in 2025, sources say

featured_image.name: Elon Musk Relocates SpaceX and X Headquarters | Brimco

items.description:
SpaceX generated approximately $8 billion in profit on revenue of $15 billion to $16 billion last year, according to a Reuters exclusive published Thursday, offering a rare glimpse into the financial performance of Elon Musk's aerospace company as it prepares for what could be the largest initial public offering in history.[1][2][3]

The profit figure represents earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization (EBITDA), a key measure of operational performance. Musk's satellite internet service Starlink drives the company's finances, accounting for 50 to 80 percent of total revenue, according to people familiar with the company's results.[4][3]

items.title: Gemini telescope reveals comet ATLAS crumbling after solar pass

featured_image.name: Comet C/2025 K1 (ATLAS) crumbles apart in stunning new ...

items.description:
Astronomers this week released new images documenting two distinct celestial objects bearing the ATLAS name: one a solar system comet that fragmented after its close solar approach, and the other an interstellar visitor that continues to puzzle scientists with its unusual jet structures and delayed detection in archival data.

The Gemini North telescope in Hawaii captured high-resolution footage of Comet C/2025 K1 (ATLAS) breaking apart, with images released Thursday showing the comet's nucleus splintering into multiple fragments following its closest approach to the Sun on October 8, 2025. Meanwhile, NASA confirmed that the interstellar object 3I/ATLAS had been present in archived TESS satellite data from May 2025—nearly two months before its official discovery on July 1, 2025.[1][2]

items.title: Oil prices ease as Trump signals openness to Iran talks

featured_image.name: Oil prices surge 3% to five-month high on worries US could ...

items.description:
Crude oil prices retreated from multi-month highs on Friday after President Donald Trump signaled he was open to talks with Iran over its nuclear program, tempering fears of an imminent military strike that had driven a sharp rally earlier in the week.

Brent crude fell nearly 1% on Friday, pulling back from the $70 level it had breached the day before for the first time since July, according to CNBC. West Texas Intermediate also declined more than 1%, dropping from the four-month highs reached Thursday.[1][2]

"President Trump's readiness to consider diplomacy with Iran appears to make a U.S. military action less probable than it was yesterday," said Tamas Varga, an analyst at PVM Oil Associates.[2]

items.title: Fewer than 50 tickets pre-sold as Melania movie opens with a whimper
items.description: Dire box office sales surrounding the US first lady's bio-doc have made headlines, but some argue there's likely a good reason Jeff Bezos's Amazon MGM Studios has splashed so much cash on MELANIA.

items.title: An anxious world awaits as Trump's perpetual bluffs come at a political price
items.description: As the US president faces domestic consequences for his violent immigration crackdown, his geopolitical bluffs across the world also come at a price.

items.title: Taylor picked as Liberal right's leading man as stalking of Ley begins
items.description: One Liberal source told the ABC a challenge to Sussan Ley's leadership is now a "matter of when, not if".

items.title: President Trump Announces U.S. Military Airstrike in Venezuela
items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.title: Trump Meets Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago for Gaza Ceasefire Phase Two Talks
items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.title: Feds Launch Massive Taxpayer Fraud Probe in Minnesota After Viral Video
items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.title: Americans Express Widespread Opposition to AI Data Centers
items.description: Public backlash against AI infrastructure data centers grows, with protests and demands for bans influencing Democratic Party strategies for future elections[3].

items.title: Elon Musk's Humanoid Robot Vision: China Poised to Lead Production
items.description: China prioritizes humanoid robots in tech race with U.S., ramping up production while warning of industry bubble and potential bottlenecks[3].

items.title: Trump-Putin Call Amid Ukraine-Russia Tensions Over Peace Plan
items.description: President Trump spoke with Putin amid ongoing Ukraine conflict, with Russia reevaluating peace plan tenets after Ukrainian denials[1].

items.title: Democratic Gubernatorial Candidates in Wisconsin Focus on Inflation and Trump
items.description: Seven Democrats vying for Wisconsin governor blame economic issues on Trump and emphasize affordability ahead of 2026 primary[3].
